title: Calories in Beef Stew
meta_description: Discover calories in beef stew per serving, including protein, carbs, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Homemade beef stew with lean beef chunks, carrots, potatoes, onions, celery, and beef broth; simmered without added oil or thickeners; ~245 g per cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, meat cut, vegetable amounts, cooking method, and brand (if canned); check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of homemade beef stew has about 250 kcal and 15 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use leaner beef and reduce oil in browning
Add extra vegetables like peas and reduce beef
Thicken with flour roux (1 tsp per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of beef stew?
faqs.a: About 250 kcal per cup of homemade beef stew.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in beef stew?
faqs.a: Roughly 15 g protein per cup from the beef and minimal from veggies.

faqs.q: Does beef stew have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 650 mg per cup, mainly from broth; low-sodium versions reduce this.

faqs.q: How do carbs in beef stew break down?
faqs.a: About 18 g total carbs per cup, with 3 g fiber from potatoes and vegetables.

faqs.q: Are canned beef stews higher in calories?
faqs.a: Often yes, due to added thickeners and preservatives; check labels for exact values.
